projects.name: Job Search Website
projects.desc: Using a pre-built API, I worked in a scrum team to build a job search website. The site utilised Tailwind, React, and Javascript. I developed distinct components to showcase recent jobs, related jobs, and individual job details. The website also features a search bar function enabling users to filter by job title or company name to interact with the back-end API.

projects.name: Blog Post Website
projects.desc: Using provided front-end code, I worked in a scrum team to develop a blog post website with PHP. The site was built following OOP design patterns and various handlers to streamline and organise the code. The website employs MySQL queries for selecting, filtering, joining, and ordering to display blog posts. Additionally, the site implements a login and registration system built from scratch, incorporating password verification to interact with the database, along with a likes and dislikes functionality. The site has also been checked with Unit Tests for the relevant methods.

projects.name: Hotel Booking API
projects.desc: The Hotel Booking System is a web application built with Laravel, a PHP framework, to manage bookings for a hotel. Using a pro-built front-end the system allows managers to make reservations for rooms and provides administrative features for hotel staff to manage bookings and room availability. Staff members can search for available rooms, view room details, and make reservations for specific dates. The system tracks room availability based on booked dates and prevents double bookings. Hotel staff have access to an different pages where they can manage bookings and view reports on room popularity. The system generates reports on room occupancy, average booking duration, and other relevant metrics to assist hotel management in decision-making.

projects.name: Card Collector App
projects.desc: The card collector app is a personal project to practice PHP concepts and skills. The app is intended to keep a wallet of digital sports cards to show off to friends and family. The site is built using PHP and mySQL to display cards from the database. The cards collection can also be filtered by sport. Within the collection a user can add cards to the site, edit details of existing cards, and remove cards from the collection.

projects.name: Recruitment Website
projects.desc: Personal re-build of a squarespace wesbite for a recruitment company. The project uses a component structure via React across the site to help code organisation and refresh speed when navigating around the site. The site combines JSX with HTML and CSS.

projects.name: Weather Forecast App
projects.desc: Personal build for a Weather Forecast Application tool developed using React.js. It provides users with accurate weather forecasts for their desired locations. Users can enter a city or town name, and the application fetches real-time weather data, including temperature and weather conditions for the next five days. The application retrieves real-time weather data from an external API, ensuring accuracy and reliability. It performs location validation to ensure that users enter valid locations. If an invalid location is entered, appropriate error messages are displayed. The background color of the application dynamically changes based on the current weather conditions, providing visual cues to users.
